alert.note: Alert for Ferry; Lincoln; Pend Oreille; Spokane; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 18 at 3:41PM PDT until September 18 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Bonner County in the Panhandle of Idaho... Northwestern Kootenai County in the Panhandle of Idaho... Northern Lincoln County in eastern Washington... Southern Stevens County in northeastern Washington... Southern Ferry County in northeastern Washington... Northern Spokane County in northeastern Washington... Southeastern Pend Oreille County in northeastern Washington... * Until 445 PM PDT. * At 337 PM PDT, an area of blowing dust is impacting portions of Northeast Washington and North Idaho. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 0 and 11. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 227 and 266, and between mile markers 295 and 334. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 166 and 196. Locations impacted include... Spokane, Priest River, Nine Mile Falls, Deer Park, Newport, Spirit Lake, Davenport, Fairwood, Suncrest, Chattaroy, Country Homes, Lincoln, Reardan, Springdale, Creston, Oldtown, Elk, Mount Spokane, Mondovi, and Rocklyn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Ferry; Lincoln; Pend Oreille; Spokane; Stevens
